One of your own companies that you hide behind.  Can never be tied back to you.
No one is quite sure who is building the strange robots and machine lairs and taking vigilante action.  But this is the shifting identity they blame such actions on.
Hold key to add newly clicked or dragged units to your selection.
Hold key to remove newly clicked or dragged units from your existing selection.
Hold key to queue orders instead of replacing the existing orders.
Hold key to draw the range of all squads.
Hold this key down to make tooltips more detailed.
Hold this key down to see things that may normally be hidden from view.  Useful for investigating an area, instead of having massive icon clutter all the time.
Toggle the game between running and paused states.
Increase the speed of the simulation so that things happen faster.
Decrease the speed of the simulation back to normal (cannot go below the default without pausing).
Hold key when clicking construction buttons to increase/decrease by 5 instead of 1.  Combine with the 'by 10' key to increase by 50.
Hold key when clicking construction buttons to increase/decrease by 10 instead of 1.  Combine with the 'by 5' key to increase by 50.
Make all movement faster.  Holding this and 'Slow Down' at the same time activates turbo, which is the fastest.
Make all movement slower.  Holding this and 'Speed Up' at the same time activates turbo, which is the fastest.
While holding this button down, mouse movements rotate and tilt the camera view.  Not allowed in battle mode.
Zoom the camera in and out with the mouse wheel.
Hold down and move the mouse to manually focus the camera.
Toggle the visual photo mode guides on or off.
Cycle through the visual focus mode grid styles.
Toggle the photo mode overlay on or off.
Open the settings for photo mode.
Toggle build mode (to construct machine lairs).
Toggle battle mode (to plan or oversee battles).
Toggle the army design window (to construct what kind of standing army you wish to have available).
Toggle the NeuroNet policy window (to chose what kind of NeuroNet service you wish to run).
Toggle the menu of tech trees.
This button toggles a list of all active investments that you are currently involved in.
This button opens the menu from which you can edit your settings, quit, etc.  It also acts as a cancel button on a lot of screens.
Determines which key functions as the Enter/Return key in the menus.
This button shifts the focus to the next textbox when there are multiple textboxes visible.
This button shifts the focus to the previous textbox when there are multiple textboxes visible.
Reload certain parts of the xml, mostly for some debug views.
Cycle All Visible Machine Lair Styles
Cycle through all the specific machine lair styles on each building, to make assigning them easier.
This does a full memory dump of the game to disk, useful for hunting memory leaks.
This does a full abort of all threads, for purposes of finding deadlocks or similar.

KeyItem/key_item/=SpaceportBlueprintsdisplay_name|Spaceport Blueprints
KeyItem/key_item/=SpaceportBlueprintsdescription|Schematics showing all of the details of how the spaceport was constructed.  Dangerous in the wrong hands.
KeyItem/key_item/=MegacorpHistorydisplay_name|Megacorp History
KeyItem/key_item/=MegacorpHistorydescription|Secret history of the nameless megacorp that owns this slice of the world.  How much of this is even true?  They'd kill anyone who has this.
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchCypherdisplay_name|Nuclear Launch Cypher
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchCypherdescription|The cypher used to launch nuclear weapons.  Requires two separate authentication words to actually unlock the cypher and do a launch.
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchKeywordOnedisplay_name|Nuclear Launch - Keyword One
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchKeywordOnedescription|The first of two keywords which, when combined with the cypher, allows for the launch of nuclear weapons.
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchKeywordTwodisplay_name|Nuclear Launch - Keyword Two
KeyItem/key_item/=NuclearLaunchKeywordTwodescription|The second of two keywords which, when combined with the cypher, allows for the launch of nuclear weapons.

Language/lang/=DescribedCohortGroup_DisplayName_Gangstext|Gangs
Language/lang/=DescribedCohortGroup_Description_Gangstext|Smaller organization of street criminals, nonetheless spread throughout the city.
Language/lang/=DescribedCohortGroup_DisplayName_ResistanceGroupstext|Resistance Groups
Language/lang/=DescribedCohortGroup_Description_ResistanceGroupstext|Underground, unsanctioned group of rebels who want to change some aspect of the status quo.

Language/lang/=Popup_ExpansionsMissingtext|All of the expansions that this mod uses, including {0} must be enabled in order to turn this mod on.  At least one expansion is not installed.
Language/lang/=TotalConversion_Endtext|End Total Conversion?
Language/lang/=TotalConversion_Starttext|Start Total Conversion?
Language/lang/=TotalConversion_End_Detailstext|Disabling this total conversion will return you to the normal game and any non-total-conversion mods you wish to use there.
		  
This will be done immediately upon clicking yes, not saving any of your other settings here.  However, any and all previously-saved settings and data from this total conversion will be retained for you.
		  
Feel free to switch back and forth into and out of total conversions as much as you wish.  The game will shut down when you turn one on or off, and you will have to manually restart the game.  But until you make the switch, it will stay in the last state you requested, indefinitely.
Language/lang/=TotalConversion_Start_Detailstext|Enabling this total conversion will completely alter the entire game, removing direct access to most other mods and using only the new set of features that are included in this mod.  This is akin to turning Half Life 1 into Counter-Strike or Day Of Defeat when it comes to the scale of the changes possible.

This will be done immediately upon clicking yes, not saving any of your other settings here.  However, any and all previously-saved settings and data from the base game will be retained for you, and in the total conversion you will have a completely separate set of settings.

Feel free to switch back and forth into and out of total conversions as much as you wish.  The game will shut down when you turn one on or off, and you will have to manually restart the game.  But until you make the switch, it will stay in the last state you requested, indefinitely.

MachineGood/machine_good/=DopamineStabilizerdisplay_name|Dopamine Stabilizer
MachineGood/machine_good/=MilitaryHUDdisplay_name|Military HUD
MachineGood/machine_good/=VolatileDenturesdisplay_name|Volatile Dentures
MachineGood/machine_good/=Heartstopperdisplay_name|Heartstopper
MachineGood/machine_good/=GPSChipdisplay_name|GPS Chip
MachineGood/machine_good/=GPSChip_Backdoordisplay_name|GPSChip
MachineGood/machine_good/=AIModuledisplay_name|AI Module
MachineGood/machine_good/=AIModuledescription|Sophisticated AI operating system with universal applications. Safeguarded against reverse-engineering.
MachineGood/machine_good/=Terraformer_Cultivatordisplay_name|Cultivator Terraformer
MachineGood/machine_good/=Terraformer_Cultivatordescription|Specialized mechs designed to terraform worlds suitable for human habitation. This variant conditions the atmosphere and cultivates the soil to support life.
MachineGood/machine_good/=Terraformer_Seederdisplay_name|Seeder Terraformer
MachineGood/machine_good/=Terraformer_Seederdescription|Specialized mechs designed to terraform worlds suitable for human habitation. This variant is dedicated to the proliferation of flora and fauna.
MachineGood/machine_good/=AgroBotdisplay_name|AgroBot
MachineGood/machine_good/=AgroBotdescription|Part mech, part farm equipment, AgroBots are of tremendous value to terraformed worlds.
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntibioticdisplay_name|Nano-Antibiotic
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntibioticdescription|Nanobots delivered to the bloodstream that neutralize even the most resistant bacteria.
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntiviraldisplay_name|Nano-Antiviral
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntiviraldescription|Nanobots delivered to the bloodstream that neutralize even the most resistant viruses.
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntiFungaldisplay_name|Nano-AntiFungal
MachineGood/machine_good/=NanoAntiFungaldescription|Nanobots delivered to the bloodstream that neutralize even the most resistant fungal infections.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Ownershipdisplay_name|Ownership
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Ownershipdescription|We have bought this building with one of our shell companies and own it outright.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=DeploymentHubdisplay_name|Deployment Hub
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=DeploymentHubdescription|Used for drop pods and drop ships, to get combat units into position and defend other machine lairs within proximity.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Factorydescription|This building is partly taken over by a hidden factory within itself.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=MindFarmdisplay_name|Mind Farm
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=MindFarmdescription|This building is partly taken over by racks and racks of unconcious humans whose minds are being used as a neural net for our own purposes.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Biolabdisplay_name|Biolab
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Biolabdescription|This building is partly taken over by a biolab that can do a variety of things.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Harvesterdisplay_name|Harvester
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=Harvesterdescription|This building is partly taken over by a facility from which robotic drones harvest from nearby buildings in an automated fashion to gather resources from unsuspecting humans.
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=ControlTowerdisplay_name|Control Tower
MachineLairType/machine_lair_type/=ControlTowerdescription|This building has a massive machine brain in it that helps us coordinate activities throughout the district.
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Hydroponicsdisplay_name|Hydroponics
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Hydroponicsdescription|This slot generates hydroponically grown resources automatically.
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=ProteinVatsdisplay_name|Protein Vats
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=ProteinVatsdescription|This slot generates vat meat grown resources automatically.
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Firebugdisplay_name|Firebug
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Firebugdescription|This slot sends out drones to add FireHazard to nearby buildings. Intended as a source of chaos in the community. Will not target player buildings.

Very suspicious though!
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Constructordisplay_name|Constructor
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Constructordescription|This slot generates Constructed goods for the player.
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Recyclerdisplay_name|Recycler
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=Recyclerdescription|This slot processes hazardous resources to make them safe.
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherUsableItemsdisplay_name|Gather Usable Items
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherUsableItemsdescription|Sends out drones to steal items that are directly useful from nearby buildings.

Extremely suspicious though!
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherHostagesdisplay_name|Gather Hostages
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherHostagesdescription|Sends out drones to kidnap humans from nearby buildings.

Extremely suspicious though!
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherRawResourcesdisplay_name|Gather Raw Resources
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherRawResourcesdescription|Sends out drones to steal raw/basic resources from nearby buildings.

Extremely suspicious though!
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherRecycleablesdisplay_name|Gather Recycleables
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=GatherRecycleablesdescription|Sends out drones to steal any resource that can be converted to raw resources from nearby buildings.

Extremely suspicious though!
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=ComputingPowerdisplay_name|Computing Power
MachineLairWorkType/machine_lair_work_type/=ComputingPowerdescription|This slot generates Computing Power for you, powered by unconscious hostages.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Nanoparticlesdisplay_name|Nanoparticles
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Nanoparticlesdescription|Nanoparticles are the cornerstone of everything we build.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedMetalsCommondisplay_name|Mixed Metals (Common)
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedMetalsCommondescription|Basic mixed metals for building things.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedMetalsRaredisplay_name|Mixed Metals (Rare)
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedMetalsRaredescription|Much more rare mixed metals for building things.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedFuelsdisplay_name|Mixed Fuels
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=MixedFuelsdescription|General reagents and gasses that can be used to make things go.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Biomassdisplay_name|Biomass
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Biomassdescription|Proteins and other biological ichor.
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Chemicalsdisplay_name|Chemicals
MachineMaterialType/machine_material/=Chemicalsdescription|Assorted chemical compounds.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=Districtdescription|Districts are large areas of the map that usually include multiple map cells.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIAlldisplay_name|POIs - All
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIAlldescription|Points Of Interest are either individual map tiles of major importance, or are smaller regions inside a single tile's cell.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIUncommondisplay_name|POIs - Uncommon
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIUncommondescription|There are not many of these kinds of Points Of Interest in most cities.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POILargedisplay_name|POIs - Large
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POILargedescription|These are the larger Points Of Interest that take up an entire cell, or multiple cells, and which are also strategically significant.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIComputingdisplay_name|POIs - Computing
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIComputingdescription|Points Of Interest focused on computing services.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POICryodisplay_name|POIs - Cryo
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POICryodescription|Points Of Interest focused on cryo freezing and prep.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIFarmdisplay_name|POIs - Farm
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIFarmdescription|Farms throughout the city.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIMiningdisplay_name|POIs - Mining
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIMiningdescription|Mining sites throughout the city.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIIndustrialdisplay_name|POIs - Industrial
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIIndustrialdescription|Truly key industrial sites in the city.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIMilitarydisplay_name|POIs - Military
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIMilitarydescription|Military bases and outposts throughout the city.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIRecreationdisplay_name|POIs - Recreation
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIRecreationdescription|Large parks and other major sources of entertainment throughout the city.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIReligiondisplay_name|POIs - Religion
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIReligiondescription|Fringe locations where religions and cults are able to 'openly' gather.
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIPowerdisplay_name|POIs - Power
MajorLocationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=POIPowerdescription|Power plants and generators throughout the city.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Wardensdisplay_name|Wardens
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Wardensdescription|These AI agents that patrol the simulation and keep the populous from 'waking up.'
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=DopamineInjectionsdisplay_name|Dopamine Injections
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=DopamineInjectionsdescription|Inject subjects with chemical stimulants generally lowering sim-rejection.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Agencydisplay_name|Agency
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Agencydescription|The degree of freedom subjects have within the simulation.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=TechLeveldisplay_name|Tech Level
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=TechLeveldescription|Simulated tech level of the simulation society. May raise or lower sim-rejection based on personality traits.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Surrealismdisplay_name|Surrealism
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Surrealismdescription|The degree of surreality of the simulation, generally lowering sim-rejection.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=SocialConnectivitydisplay_name|Social Connectivity
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=SocialConnectivitydescription|The degree of interactions subjects have with each other inside the simulation, the rest of the sim populated by NPC AI actors. Can lower sim-rejection but may allow collaboration if subjects can identify each other.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Lawfulnessdisplay_name|Lawfulness
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Lawfulnessdescription|The strength of law within the simulation society. May raise or lower sim-rejection based on personality traits.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=NPCDensitydisplay_name|NPC Density
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=NPCDensitydescription|The frequency of NPC AI actors relative to subjects within the sim, making the simulated world more (or less) populous than it would otherwise be.
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Peacefuldisplay_name|Peacefulness
NeuroNetPolicyType/neuro_net_policy_type/=Peacefuldescription|The general atmosphere of the simulated society, approximately ranging from anarchy to utopia. May raise or lower sim-rejection based on personality traits.
NeuroNetPopulationType/neuro_net_population_type/=Willingdisplay_name|Willing
NeuroNetPopulationType/neuro_net_population_type/=Unwillingdisplay_name|Unwilling
NeuroNetQualityType/neuro_net_quality_type/=VisualFidelitydisplay_name|Visual Fidelity
NeuroNetQualityType/neuro_net_quality_type/=VisualFidelitydescription|How good it looks
NeuroNetQualityType/neuro_net_quality_type/=SensoryChannelsdisplay_name|SensoryChannels
NeuroNetQualityType/neuro_net_quality_type/=SensoryChannelsdescription|Number of additional simulated sensations
NPCRole/npc_role/=CEOdisplay_name|CEO
NPCRole/npc_role/=CEOdescription|The head of a large company.
NPCRole/npc_role/=CFOdisplay_name|CFO
NPCRole/npc_role/=CFOdescription|Chief Financial Officer of a large company. Holds many secrets, particularly financial ones.
NPCRole/npc_role/=CSOdisplay_name|CSO
NPCRole/npc_role/=CSOdescription|Chief Security Officer of a large company. Holds many secrets, particularly ones about building security for this company.
NPCRole/npc_role/=CHROdisplay_name|CHRO
NPCRole/npc_role/=CHROdescription|Chief Human Resources Officer of a large company. Holds many secrets, particularly ones about employees for this company.
NPCRole/npc_role/=BusinessOwnerdisplay_name|Business Owner
NPCRole/npc_role/=BusinessOwnerdescription|The head of a smaller company.
NPCRole/npc_role/=RebelLeaderdisplay_name|Rebel Leader
NPCRole/npc_role/=RebelLeaderdescription|Leader of a rebel group.
NPCRole/npc_role/=ReligiousLeaderdisplay_name|Religious Leader
NPCRole/npc_role/=ReligiousLeaderdescription|Spiritual leader of a state approved religion.
NPCRole/npc_role/=CultLeaderdisplay_name|Cult Leader
NPCRole/npc_role/=CultLeaderdescription|Chraismatic leader of a cult.
NPCRole/npc_role/=ParamilitaryLeaderdisplay_name|Paramilitary Leader
NPCRole/npc_role/=ParamilitaryLeaderdescription|Leader of a paramilitary organization.
NPCRole/npc_role/=Bookkeeperdisplay_name|Bookkeeper
NPCRole/npc_role/=Bookkeeperdescription|Financial manager for a smaller company.
NPCRole/npc_role/=FireChiefdisplay_name|FireChief
NPCRole/npc_role/=FireChiefdescription|Commanding Officer at a fire department.
NPCRole/npc_role/=FireCommissionerdisplay_name|Fire Commissioner
NPCRole/npc_role/=FireCommissionerdescription|Overseer of the fire civil service corp.
NPCRole/npc_role/=WasteSanitationManagerdisplay_name|Waste Maintenance Manager
NPCRole/npc_role/=WasteSanitationManagerdescription|Oversees sanitation maintenance at a waste treatment facility.
NPCRole/npc_role/=WasteTreatmentDirectordisplay_name|Waste Treatment Director
NPCRole/npc_role/=WasteTreatmentDirectordescription|Chief overseer of waste treatment operations for all waste treatment facilities.
NPCRole/npc_role/=WaterPurificationManagerdisplay_name|Water Purification Manager
NPCRole/npc_role/=WaterPurificationManagerdescription|Oversees maintenance at a water purification facility.
NPCRole/npc_role/=WaterPurificationDirectordisplay_name|Water Purification Director
NPCRole/npc_role/=WaterPurificationDirectordescription|Chief overseer of water purification operations for all water purification facilities.
NPCRole/npc_role/=PowerplantManagerdisplay_name|Powerplant Manager
NPCRole/npc_role/=PowerplantManagerdescription|General manager for a powerplant.
NPCRole/npc_role/=ResearchandDevelopmentDirectordisplay_name|R and D Director
NPCRole/npc_role/=ResearchandDevelopmentDirectordescription|General manager for a science lab.
NPCRole/npc_role/=CelebrityEntertainerdisplay_name|Celebrity Entertainer
NPCRole/npc_role/=CelebrityEntertainerdescription|Widely famous entertainer, respected by all classes of society.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Ambitiondisplay_name|Ambition
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Ambitiondescription|How much the desire for power drives this person.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Braverydisplay_name|Bravery
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Braverydescription|How hard it is to make this person panic in stressful situations.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Curiositydisplay_name|Curiosity
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Curiositydescription|How likely this person is to seek out information beyond what is presented to them.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Gullibilitydisplay_name|Gullibility
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Gullibilitydescription|How likely this person is to fall for untruths.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Integritydisplay_name|Integrity
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Integritydescription|How likely this person is keep an agreement they make.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Intelligentdisplay_name|Intelligent
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Intelligentdescription|How naturally gifted towards fast learning, technical endeavors, etc. regardless of actual education.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Kindnessdisplay_name|Kindness
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Kindnessdescription|How willing to treat others with respect, give second chances, and so on.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Lazydisplay_name|Lazy
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Lazydescription|How disinclined towards putting forth effort to accomplish tasks, even if strongly desired.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Loyaltydisplay_name|Loyalty
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Loyaltydescription|How likely this person is to stay true to their faction or cohort.
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Persuasivenessdisplay_name|Persuasiveness
NPCTrait/npc_trait/=Persuasivenessdescription|The ability of this person to convert other people to their way of thinking about a topic.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Introvertdisplay_name|Introvert
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Introvertdescription|Keeps to themselves.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Extrovertdisplay_name|Extrovert
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Extrovertdescription|Party-goers.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Aggressivedisplay_name|Aggressive
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Aggressivedescription|Might makes right.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Diplomaticdisplay_name|Diplomatic
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Diplomaticdescription|The pen is mightier than the sword.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Lazydescription|Work is hard.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Productivedisplay_name|Productive
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Productivedescription|Work is life.
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Intelligentdescription|'I know everything about everything!'
PersonTrait/person_trait/=Uneducateddescription|School is for chumps
POIType/poi_type/=AirportLargedisplay_name|Airport (Large)
POIType/poi_type/=AirportLargedescription|The largest airport in the city.
POIType/poi_type/=AirportSmalldisplay_name|Airport (Small)
POIType/poi_type/=AirportSmalldescription|Smaller airport in the city.
POIType/poi_type/=CommStationdescription|Lots of communications equipment for talking across the planet, and to near and deep space.
POIType/poi_type/=Cryopolisdisplay_name|Cryopolis
POIType/poi_type/=Cryopolisdescription|Large complex focused on the cryogeneic freezing and storage of citizens.  Plenty of other nanotech and secondary activities also happening here.
POIType/poi_type/=CryopolisMinidisplay_name|Cryopolis (Mini)
POIType/poi_type/=CryopolisMinidescription|Small complex focused on the cryogeneic freezing and storage of citizens, plus other sciences.
POIType/poi_type/=DeepSpaceRadioTelescopedisplay_name|Deep Space Radio Telescope
POIType/poi_type/=DeepSpaceRadioTelescopedescription|Massive radio telescope is its own district.  Focused on deep-space scientific imaging, as well as housing other scientific facilities.
POIType/poi_type/=Farmdescription|One of the main farms providing food for the city.
POIType/poi_type/=FarmMinidisplay_name|Farm (Mini)
POIType/poi_type/=FarmMinidescription|Smaller farm tucked away in the city.
POIType/poi_type/=MiningHeliumdisplay_name|Mining (Helium)
POIType/poi_type/=MiningHeliumdescription|Mining focused in particular on helium.
POIType/poi_type/=MiningNGasdisplay_name|Mining (Natural Gas)
POIType/poi_type/=MiningNGasdescription|Mining focused in particular on natural gas.
POIType/poi_type/=MiningOildisplay_name|Mining (Oil)
POIType/poi_type/=MiningOildescription|Mining focused in particular on oil.
POIType/poi_type/=MiningOilMinidisplay_name|Mining (Oil - Mini)
POIType/poi_type/=MiningOilMinidescription|Very small mining operation focused on oil.
POIType/poi_type/=MiningAndSciencedisplay_name|Mining (And Science)
POIType/poi_type/=MiningAndSciencedescription|Mining and science facility.
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseLargedisplay_name|Military Base (Large)
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseLargedescription|Massive military installation.  There are only a few of these in the city, and they are each a district unto themselves.
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseNormaldisplay_name|Military Base (Normal)
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseNormaldescription|Midsize military installation.  There are only but so many of these in the city, and they add power and threat to the districts they are a part of.
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseMinidisplay_name|Military Base (Mini)
POIType/poi_type/=MilitaryBaseMinidescription|Very small military installation.  Extra muscle and enforcement in the district it is a part of.
POIType/poi_type/=NuclearSilodescription|Massive military installation built around the resident nuclear warhead launch silos.  There are only a few of these in the city, and they are each a district unto themselves.
POIType/poi_type/=ParkLargedisplay_name|Park (Large)
POIType/poi_type/=ParkLargedescription|Large recreational and nature area.
POIType/poi_type/=PowerNuclearLargedisplay_name|Power - Nuclear (Large)
POIType/poi_type/=PowerNuclearLargedescription|Large nuclear plant providing large amounts of power to the city.  High security, and a district unto itself.
POIType/poi_type/=PowerNuclearSmalldisplay_name|Power - Nuclear (Small)
POIType/poi_type/=PowerNuclearSmalldescription|Small nuclear power installation.  Provides power to its district, still at a large yield, but with much lower security.
POIType/poi_type/=PowerThermaldisplay_name|Power - Thermal
POIType/poi_type/=PowerThermaldescription|Small themal power generator.  Provides power to its district.
POIType/poi_type/=PowerWinddisplay_name|Power - Wind
POIType/poi_type/=PowerWinddescription|Small wind farm.  Provides power to its district.
POIType/poi_type/=PowerSolardisplay_name|Power - Solar
POIType/poi_type/=PowerSolardescription|Small solar farm.  Provides power to its district.
POIType/poi_type/=Spaceportdescription|The singular massive spaceport of the city, which is the only way The MegaCorp or anyone else in this city has for getting people and goods to and from space.
POIType/poi_type/=Casinodescription|Major hub for gambling.
POIType/poi_type/=DataCenterdescription|Major hub for computer processing.
POIType/poi_type/=EncryptedFleetCommunicationUplinkdescription|Direct line to the space nations.
POIType/poi_type/=AbandonedChurchdescription|Hotbed of cultists.
POIType/poi_type/=MechFactorydescription|Rare production facility of mechs.
POIType/poi_type/=CountryClubdisplay_name|Country Club
POIType/poi_type/=CountryClubdescription|Hub for spying on the wealthy.
PopulationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=EconomicClassdisplay_name|Economic Class
PopulationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=EconomicClassdescription|Housing is available by economic class.
PopulationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=Professiondisplay_name|Profession
PopulationAggregationType/aggregation_type/=Professiondescription|Buildings must be worked by various kinds of professions depending on what happens there.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=Administrativedisplay_name|Administrative
ProfessionType/profession_type/=Administrativedescription|Ranging from noble Chief Executive work, all the way through the upper executive ranks down into lowly middle-managerdom.  It's still better to be an administrator than any other form of work, if you're looking for a comfortable life.  Angry the wrong political opponents and you can wind up in prison, however, so it's good to make sure even your private opinions are safe ones.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=HighSciencesdisplay_name|High Sciences
ProfessionType/profession_type/=HighSciencesdescription|The back that pulls the plow of society, or something.  Society is actually quite stagnant, so they must not be pulling hard enough.  Anyone with a doctoral degree or advanced credentialing is considered high sciences for tax purposes.  Doctors, professors, scientists, highest-quality engineers, lawyers, and so on.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=OfficeWorkdisplay_name|Office Work
ProfessionType/profession_type/=OfficeWorkdescription|The lucrative but thankless side of middle-class work offerings.  Office work might be important, vital even -- or it might be just filling out paperwork to document the existence of other paperwork.  You never can tell until you have the job, and once you're in a job, you don't dare complain.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=Creativedisplay_name|Creative
ProfessionType/profession_type/=Creativedescription|Pay is the worst out of all the middle-class work offerings, but job satisfaction is... also not great?  Writers, artists, musicians, and other dreamers... well, they're probably working on advertising or brochures, let's be honest.  A lucky few get to work in film or other entertainment media, and the censorship is actually lower than you might expect.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=SkilledLabordisplay_name|Skilled Labor
ProfessionType/profession_type/=SkilledLabordescription|The pay might be midrange, but the respect is off the charts.  These are the fixers, the people who know how objects fit together and machines are supposed to operate.  If you have at least a two-year degree and know something about something, you might find yourself one of the most satisfied individuals in the city -- if you can find and afford an apprenticeship, that is.
ProfessionType/profession_type/=MenialLabordisplay_name|Menial Labor
ProfessionType/profession_type/=MenialLabordescription|Day labor, construction, janitorial.  It's not much pay and it's even less respect, but unless there are a lot of improvements to robotics, you at least have job security.
QualitySettingsType/qualitySettingsType/=Very Lowdisplay_name|Very Low
QualitySettingsType/qualitySettingsType/=Lowdisplay_name|Low
QualitySettingsType/qualitySettingsType/=Highdisplay_name|High
QualitySettingsType/qualitySettingsType/=Very Highdisplay_name|Very High
QualitySettingsType/qualitySettingsType/=Ultradisplay_name|Ultra

RandomNamePart/name_part/=AN1_Northwestdisplay_name|Northwest
RandomNamePart/name_part/=AN1_Northerndisplay_name|Northern

RandomNamePart/name_part/=AN1_Flightdisplay_name|Flight

RandomNamePart/name_part/=AN1_Ionopausedisplay_name|Ionopause
RandomNamePart/name_part/=AN1_Atmosphericdisplay_name|Atmospheric

Setting/setting/=EnableVoicedisplay_name|Voice
Setting/setting/=EnableVoicedescription|If disabled, no spoken voice audio plays.
Setting/setting/=MasterVolumedisplay_name|Master Volume
Setting/setting/=MasterVolumedescription|Volume of all sound in general, music and sound effects and so on.  Adjusting this keeps the relative volumes of sub-channels as they are.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=MusicVolumedisplay_name|Music Volume
Setting/setting/=MusicVolumedescription|Volume of the music, relative to all non-music sound.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=SoundVolumedisplay_name|Sound Volume
Setting/setting/=SoundVolumedescription|Volume of all sound effects in general, relative to the music.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=WorldSoundVolumedisplay_name|World Sound Volume
Setting/setting/=WorldSoundVolumedescription|Volume of the sounds of the noises of the world, relative to the interface and music/ambience.  Adjusting this keeps the relative volumes of sub-channels as they are.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=BigSoundsVolumedisplay_name|Big Sounds Volume
Setting/setting/=BigSoundsVolumedescription|Large sudden sounds, which cause the music or ambience to duck a bit.  Notable explosions, death cries, sounds of ominous intent, etc.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=MassiveSoundsVolumedisplay_name|Massive Sounds Volume
Setting/setting/=MassiveSoundsVolumedescription|Truly giant sounds, which quiet almost everything else and arrest your attention on whatever is going on here.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=MagicVolumedisplay_name|Magic Volume
Setting/setting/=MagicVolumedescription|Volume of magic spells, primarily during combat but also outside of combat when relevant.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=PhysicalWeaponsVolumedisplay_name|Physical Weapons Volume
Setting/setting/=PhysicalWeaponsVolumedescription|Volume of the sound of physical weapon strikes (including creature physical attacks).  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=ConstructionVolumedisplay_name|Construction Volume
Setting/setting/=ConstructionVolumedescription|Volume of the sounds of construction, at your bases or otherwise.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=EnvironmentEffectsVolumedisplay_name|Environment Effects Volume
Setting/setting/=EnvironmentEffectsVolumedescription|Volume of environmental sounds with a specific source (water falling, fires crackling, etc).  Does not include general ambience like wind rustling in trees.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=CharacterFoleyVolumedisplay_name|Character Foley Volume
Setting/setting/=CharacterFoleyVolumedescription|Volume of sounds made by characters (footsteps, armor jingle, etc).  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=OtherWorldSoundsVolumedisplay_name|Other World Sounds Volume
Setting/setting/=OtherWorldSoundsVolumedescription|Volume of other miscellaneous sounds that happen in the world and don't fit into another category.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=VoiceAndInterfaceMasterVolumedisplay_name|Voice And Interface Parent Volume
Setting/setting/=VoiceAndInterfaceMasterVolumedescription|Volume of all non-world sound effects in general, relative to the world sound effects.  Adjusting this keeps the relative volumes of sub-channels as they are.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=InterfaceVolumedisplay_name|Interface Volume
Setting/setting/=InterfaceVolumedescription|Volume of click sound effects and other interface feedback.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=VoiceRoutineVolumedisplay_name|Voice Volume (Routine)
Setting/setting/=VoiceRoutineVolumedescription|Volume of normal voices of characters.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=VoiceLargeVolumedisplay_name|Voice Volume (Large)
Setting/setting/=VoiceLargeVolumedescription|Volume of voices that are large and extra intimidating.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.
Setting/setting/=AlertVolumedisplay_name|Alert Volume
Setting/setting/=AlertVolumedescription|Volume of voice and nonverbal alerts of high importance.  Can range from 0 to 200.  This is relative to its starting value in the mixer, so the default is always 100.  Default is louder than average.
Setting/setting/=Camera_lastDepthOfFieldEnableddisplay_name|Main Camera: Depth Of Field Enabled
Setting/setting/=Camera_lastDepthOfFieldEnableddescription|If you dislike the depth of field visual effect during normal gameplay, you can turn it off.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldAutofocusDistanceShiftdisplay_name|Main DOF: Autofocus Distance Offset
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldAutofocusDistanceShiftdescription|If you would like for the autofocus of the depth of field to skew higher or lower, then you can adjust this positive or negative.  The default of 0 means no offset.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldDownsamplingdisplay_name|Main DOF: Downsampling
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldDownsamplingdescription|With downsampling above 1, you'll get better performance, but progressively worse image quality (mainly edges not lining up correctly).  With a downsampling of 1, no downsampling is done.
			 
Defaults to 2 on the main camera.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldMaxSamplesdisplay_name|Main DOF: Max Samples
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldMaxSamplesdescription|More samples leads to a higher quality visual effect, but at the cost of performance.
			 
Defaults to 4 on the main camera.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldImageSensorHeightdisplay_name|Main DOF: Image Sensor Height
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldImageSensorHeightdescription|How high is the simulated image sensor?  No impact on performance, but impacts how the camera effect behaves.  Default is 24.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldFStopdisplay_name|Main DOF: F-Stop
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldFStopdescription|What is the f-stop of the simulated camera lens?  The f-stop of camera is fractional, so this is the denominator of that fraction.  If you choose 2.6, then that would be an f-stop of 1/2.6 for photographers.
			 
The smaller the number, the shallower the depth of field (the smaller the amount of the image that will be in focus, and the more dramatic the background focus), while the larger the number, the wider the focus.

In the normal camera mode, we use a default of 7, which is not on the wider end, making blur far less dramatic than in photo mode.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldFocalLengthRealdisplay_name|Main DOF: Focal Length
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldFocalLengthRealdescription|What is the focal length of the simulated camera lens?  The focal length of the lens is the distance between the lens and the image sensor when the subject is in focus, in millimeters.
			 
This affects the magnification of the scene, for depth of field purposes.  The default of 24mm keeps most of the image crisp in the regular mode, but also fairly flat.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldForegroundDistancedisplay_name|Main DOF: Foreground Distance
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldForegroundDistancedescription|This has no analogue in physical cameras.  This specifies how close to the camera foreground blur should kick in.  The default of 0.25 leads to a 'small world' visual effect, since we are simulating everything at 1/10th normal scale.
			 
To get something that seems more like normal scale, reduce this number, potentially as low as 0.025.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldBokehThresholddisplay_name|Main DOF: Bokeh Threshold
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldBokehThresholddescription|At what level of light do we start seeing bokeh, or visual artifacts from out of focus elements?  The default of 1 will only show it for very bright objects, mostly lights.
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldBokehIntensitydisplay_name|Main DOF: Bokeh Intensity
Setting/setting/=Camera_depthOfFieldBokehIntensitydescription|How visually intense are the bokeh artifacts?  The default of 2 is likely fine unless you want really specific visual effects.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldAutofocusDistanceShiftdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Autofocus Distance Offset
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldDownsamplingdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Downsampling
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldDownsamplingdescription|With downsampling above 1, you'll get better performance, but progressively worse image quality (mainly edges not lining up correctly).  With a downsampling of 1, no downsampling is done.
			 
Defaults to 1 on the photo mode camera.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldMaxSamplesdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Max Samples
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldMaxSamplesdescription|More samples leads to a higher quality visual effect, but at the cost of performance.
			 
Defaults to 8 on the photo mode camera.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldImageSensorHeightdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Image Sensor Height
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldFStopdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: F-Stop
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldFStopdescription|What is the f-stop of the simulated camera lens?  The f-stop of camera is fractional, so this is the denominator of that fraction.  If you choose 2.6, then that would be an f-stop of 1/2.6 for photographers.
			 
The smaller the number, the shallower the depth of field (the smaller the amount of the image that will be in focus, and the more dramatic the background focus), while the larger the number, the wider the focus.

In the photo mode camera, we use a default of 2, which is on the narrow end of things.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldFocalLengthRealdisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Focal Length
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldFocalLengthRealdescription|What is the focal length of the simulated camera lens?  The focal length of the lens is the distance between the lens and the image sensor when the subject is in focus, in millimeters.
			 
This affects the magnification of the scene, for depth of field purposes.  The default of 50mm is probably fine for most purposes.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldForegroundDistancedisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Foreground Distance
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldBokehThresholddisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Bokeh Threshold
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldBokehThresholddescription|At what level of light do we start seeing bokeh, or visual artifacts from out of focus elements?  The default of 0.8 will show it for fairly bright objects, with brighter objects having a stronger effect.
			 
Turn this up to 1, or above, if you want a flatter blur.
Setting/setting/=PhotoMode_depthOfFieldBokehIntensitydisplay_name|Photo Mode DOF: Bokeh Intensity
Setting/setting/=Debug_ExportDataTablesAsLoadedAndReloadeddisplay_name|Export Data Tables As Loaded And Reloaded (Skip GamEntity)
Setting/setting/=Debug_ExportDataTablesAsLoadedAndReloadeddescription|After the xml files are initially loaded, or are reloaded into the in-memory data tables (from changing active mods or expansions), write a text file for each one into a DataTablesAfterInitial and DataTablesAfterReload subfolders in the PlayerData folder.  

The purpose of this is mainly to use with diffing tools between this copy and the on-main-load copy and see if something went wrong during the reload.  If you are modding and made changes to some ships and want to see how those changes cascaded, this would be one way to do that.  This is also a way for us to verify correctness when we make structural changes internally.
Setting/setting/=UseFullscreendisplay_name|Use Fullscreen
Setting/setting/=UseFullscreendescription|Run in fullscreen mode, or windowed mode?
Setting/setting/=QualitySettingsTypedisplay_name|Quality Level
Setting/setting/=QualitySettingsTypedescription|Adjusts the general visual quality, including things like shadow draw distance and quality.  Has a substantial impact on visual performance, and a moderate impact on visual quality.
Setting/setting/=FramerateTypedisplay_name|Framerate
Setting/setting/=FramerateTypedescription|Please note that this is NOT the same as setting a refresh rate on your monitor.  Mostly.
 <size=9>       
If you set VSync or Half-VSync, then indeed it will limit to those and you will likely see terrible performance.  Using vsync is a really bad idea, in that it really causes issues with variable-length frames, and will make your game choppier.

Assuming that you are using any other options in this list, it is telling the game to 'try to run at about that framerate.'  That won't actually mean the game runs at that framerate, but it will mean that the game tries to not run on average MORE than that framerate.  For one example, you don't need the game running at 300fps for no reason and having your GPU fan going nuts.  On the other hand, if the game gets choppy when above 60fps for you on an older machine, you might want to cap it at 60fps.  If you wish to set this to match your monitor refresh rate, that is fine, but please bear in mind that the non-vsync versions of this are very very much 'weak suggestions for maximum framerate,' and not any sort of hard limiter.
 <size=10>     
Looking for excellent technology to eliminate screen tearing without eliminating game performance?  The things to look into are GSync and FreeSync.
Setting/setting/=WindowWidthdisplay_name|Window Width
Setting/setting/=WindowWidthdescription|Width of the screen when in windowed mode ONLY.  Can be any number between 600 and 9000.  Defaults to 1000.  You probably want it larger.
Setting/setting/=WindowHeightdisplay_name|Window Height
Setting/setting/=WindowHeightdescription|Height of the screen when in windowed mode ONLY.  Can be any number between 400 and 7000.  Defaults to 600.  You probably want it larger.
Setting/setting/=FullscreenResolutiondisplay_name|Fullscreen Resolution
Setting/setting/=FullscreenResolutiondescription|The following options are available for fullscreen resolutions, based on a combination of what your monitor reports as possible and what are common resolutions.
Setting/setting/=InvertMouseZoomdisplay_name|Invert Mousewheel Zoom
Setting/setting/=InvertMouseZoomdescription|Normally when you spin the mouse wheel forward, you zoom in; spinning backwards zooms out.  This lets you flip that functionality.  OR, in the case that your hardware or OS is inverted for whatever reason, this lets you correct it to work like everyone else.

Note: if you also want/need to invert how your mouse wheel works when scrolling UI elements, then be sure to also set the 'Invert Mousewheel UI Scrolling' option in the Input tab.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultPitchdisplay_name|Camera Default Pitch
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultPitchdescription|What angle down does the camera start out by default?  Default is looking 31 degrees down.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MinPitchdisplay_name|Camera Minmum Pitch
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MinPitchdescription|What is the shallowest (most sideways) angle the camera can look down?  Default is 10.
			 
If you go negative, that will let the camera look back upwards more (usually this is more of a photo mode angle).
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MaxPitchdisplay_name|Camera Max Pitch
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MaxPitchdescription|What is the steepest angle the main camera can look down?  The defauult is 70.
			 
If you go above 90, you'll be inverted and things get quite confusing to play.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultYawdisplay_name|Camera Default Yaw
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultYawdescription|What angle does the camera start out facing by default?  Default -38 degrees.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultZoomdisplay_name|Camera Default Zoom
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_DefaultZoomdescription|How high above the ground does the camera start out by default?  The default is 6.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MinZoomdisplay_name|Camera Minmum Zoom
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MinZoomdescription|How far down to the ground can the camera normally go?  Default is 2 above the ground, still comfortably above where the people are.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MaxZoomdisplay_name|Camera Max Zoom
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_MaxZoomdescription|How far above the ground can the main camera go?  Default is 20.
Setting/setting/=CameraRotationAndTiltSensitivity_Xdisplay_name|Camera Rotation And Tilt Sensitivity (X)
Setting/setting/=CameraRotationAndTiltSensitivity_Xdescription|When you are holding down the buttons that let you tilt and rotate the camera, the movements of your mouse will do those actions based on the sensitivity defined here.
Setting/setting/=CameraRotationAndTiltSensitivity_Ydisplay_name|Camera Rotation And Tilt Sensitivity (Y)
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedSlowdisplay_name|Camera Speed (Slow)
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedSlowdescription|When holding the 'move slowly' control, how fast does the main camera move?  Default is 1.  Note that at higher altitudes, all movements are amplified.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedNormaldisplay_name|Camera Speed (Normal)
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedNormaldescription|When not holding any movement speed multiplier control, how fast does the main camera move?  Default is 2.  Note that at higher altitudes, all movements are amplified.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedFastdisplay_name|Camera Speed (Fast)
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedFastdescription|When holding the 'move fast' control, how fast does the main camera move?  Default is 4.  Note that at higher altitudes, all movements are amplified.
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedTurbodisplay_name|Camera Speed (Turbo)
Setting/setting/=MainCamera_SpeedTurbodescription|When holding the 'move fast' and 'move slow' controls together, which activates turbo, how fast does the main camera move?  Default is 8.  Note that at higher altitudes, all movements are amplified.
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Slowdisplay_name|Mouse Zoom Sensitivity (Slow)
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Slowdescription|How fast the camera zooms in and out when you are using the mouse wheel to trigger zoom, and holding the 'slow movement' key.
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Normaldisplay_name|Mouse Zoom Sensitivity (Normal)
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Normaldescription|How fast the camera zooms in and out when you are using the mouse wheel to trigger zoom.
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Fastdisplay_name|Mouse Zoom Sensitivity (Fast)
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Fastdescription|How fast the camera zooms in and out when you are using the mouse wheel to trigger zoom, and holding the 'fast movement' key.
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Turbodisplay_name|Mouse Zoom Sensitivity (Turbo)
Setting/setting/=CameraMain_MouseZoomSensitivity_Turbodescription|How fast the camera zooms in and out when you are using the mouse wheel to trigger zoom, and holding both the 'slow movement' and 'fast movement' keys.
Setting/setting/=BattleCamera_PanningMultiliplierdisplay_name|Panning Multiliplier
Setting/setting/=BattleCamera_PanningMultiliplierdescription|When in the battle camera, you're focused on a much smaller area than normal.  How much slower, if at all, is the camera going to move in this mode?  Default is 0.7, or 70% speed.
Setting/setting/=BattleCamera_ZoomMultiliplierdisplay_name|Zoom Multiliplier
Setting/setting/=BattleCamera_ZoomMultiliplierdescription|When in the battle camera, you're focused on a much smaller area than normal.  How much slower, if at all, is the camera going to move in this mode?  Default is 0.3, or 30% speed.
Setting/setting/=SwitchSidebarToTheLeftdisplay_name|Switch Sidebar To The Left
Setting/setting/=SwitchSidebarToTheLeftdescription|If you prefer to have the sidebar on the left side of your screen instead of the right, this will swap it for you (along with many other related UI elements).
Setting/setting/=MainGameCarsDriveOnTheRightdisplay_name|Right handed roads
Setting/setting/=MainGameCarsDriveOnTheRightdescription|Which side of the roads do drivers drive on? Note: changing this won't update any currently spawned vehicles.
Setting/setting/=MainGameJumpStraightIntoGameForTestingdisplay_name|Jump Straight Into Game For Testing
Setting/setting/=MainGameJumpStraightIntoGameForTestingdescription|No button presses required, just start a new game.
Setting/setting/=ShowCompassBardisplay_name|Show Compass Bar
Setting/setting/=ShowCompassBardescription|Interested in knowing what is north, south, east, and west?  Here you go.
Setting/setting/=HeaderBarScaledisplay_name|Header Bar Scale
Setting/setting/=HeaderBarScaledescription|How large should the header bar at the top of the screen be?  Default is 1.2.
Setting/setting/=SidebarScaledisplay_name|Sidebar Scale
Setting/setting/=SidebarScaledescription|How large should the sidebar be?  Default is 0.8.
Setting/setting/=GeneralTooltipScaledisplay_name|General Tooltip Scale
Setting/setting/=GeneralTooltipScaledescription|For the various 'standard text tooltips' in the game, such as this one, how large should the text in them be?  If your monitor is large, then the default may feel oversized.  Hit save to see how the new sizing looks.
Setting/setting/=CentralPopupTextScaledisplay_name|Central Popup Text Scale
Setting/setting/=CentralPopupTextScaledescription|How large should the text inside of any center-screen popups be?  This doesn't affect the size of the window itself, just the text inside it (so you have a lot less scrolling to do.  Default is 0.9.
Setting/setting/=Debug_MainGameShowOBBOfSingleObjectUnderCursordisplay_name|Show OBB Of Single Object Under Cursor
Setting/setting/=Debug_MainGameShowOBBOfSingleObjectUnderCursordescription|For debugging purposes, show the Oriented Bounding Box (OBB) when you hover over a single object.
Setting/setting/=TrafficAndPedestrianDensitydisplay_name|Traffic And Pedestrian Density
Setting/setting/=TrafficAndPedestrianDensitydescription|When traffic and pedestrians are more dense, it looks great, but can affect performance negatively.  It has no effect on gameplay.
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_BuildingZonesdisplay_name|Skip Loading Decorations For Building Zones
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_BuildingZonesdescription|The city will be more barren, but will load notably faster and also have less to draw in the background.
			 
Parametrically-applied trees and flowers and trash and such around buildings will be absent, leading to a more minimalist effect.
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_DecorationZonesdisplay_name|Skip Loading Decorations For Decoration Zones
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_DecorationZonesdescription|The city will be more barren, but will load faster and also have less to draw in the background.
			 
Parametrically-applied trees and flowers and trash and such in the areas that are specifically designated for them will be omitted, making for some odd gaps visually, but otherwise it's functional.
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_HoleTilesdisplay_name|Skip Loading Decorations For Wilderness Cells
Setting/setting/=SkipLoadingDecorations_HoleTilesdescription|The city will be more barren, but will load faster and also have less to draw in the background.
			 
Parametrically-applied trees and flowers and trash and such in the areas of 'wilderness' cells within the city will be blank instead, but this does not affect function in any way.
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_Buildingsdisplay_name|Cell Draw Distance: Buildings
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_Buildingsdescription|The game is broken up into visual cells for drawing.  How many cells away should be drawn when looking sideways, as far as buildings go?  Larger amounts will look cooler for photos, but give a lower framerate.
		   
The default of 5 is not a bad idea in most cases, because buildings are large but only so numerous.  This keeps the skyline the most accurate and avoids pop-in.
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_Roadsdisplay_name|Cell Draw Distance: Roads
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_Roadsdescription|The game is broken up into visual cells for drawing.  How many cells away should be drawn when looking sideways, as far as roads go?  Larger amounts will look cooler for photos, but give a lower framerate.
			 
Roads are more numerous than buildings, and in a lot of cases you can't even see roads that are too distant past all of the buildings.  The default of 4 should work well even in parts of the city that are not densely populated.
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_MajorDecorationsdisplay_name|Cell Draw Distance: Major Decorations
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_MajorDecorationsdescription|The game is broken up into visual cells for drawing.  How many cells away should be drawn when looking sideways, as far as major decorations go?  Larger amounts will look cooler for photos, but give a lower framerate.
			 
Major decorations showing out to a distance of 4 as a default should work well for parts of the city that are not densely populated.
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_MinorDecorationsdisplay_name|Cell Draw Distance: Minor Decorations
Setting/setting/=CellDrawDist_MinorDecorationsdescription|The game is broken up into visual cells for drawing.  How many cells away should be drawn when looking sideways, as far as minor decorations go?  Larger amounts will look cooler for photos, but give a lower framerate.
			 
Minor decorations showing out to a distance of 1 as a default should be sufficient in most cases even on very powerful games.
Setting/setting/=ShowAdvancedSettingsdisplay_name|Show Advanced Settings
Setting/setting/=ShowAdvancedSettingsdescription|There are a whole lot of these, friend.  If you're not already super into the game or having a specific problem, it's a good idea to steer clear of these.  The defaults are awesome 99% of the time.
Setting/setting/=UseUnrestricteUIUpdateSpeedsdisplay_name|Use Unrestricted UI Update Speeds
Setting/setting/=UseUnrestricteUIUpdateSpeedsdescription|Normally, most UI windows only update their contents every 50-100 milliseconds.  If your framerate is much higher than this, however, you may prefer that the UI update at whatever your actual framerate is.
           
This will likely reduce your framerate, potentially substantially, but it leads to the ultimate in responsiveness.
Setting/setting/=EnablePerformanceLoggingdisplay_name|Enable Performance Logging
Setting/setting/=EnablePerformanceLoggingdescription|Turning this on may hurt performance a bit, but not hugely so in most cases.  It lets you then see a lot of information about how the game is spending its CPU time by right-clicking the timer in the bottom left of the main game view.  Off by default, as it has no other purpose than that.
Setting/setting/=MousewheelCameraZoomSpeed_Normaldisplay_name|Mousewheel Camera Zoom Speed (Normal)
Setting/setting/=MousewheelCameraZoomSpeed_Normaldescription|How fast should the mouse wheel normally zoom in or out your view, assuming that you are NOT holding down the 'go faster' button?
Setting/setting/=MousewheelCameraZoomSpeed_Fastdisplay_name|Mousewheel Camera Zoom Speed (Fast)
Setting/setting/=MousewheelCameraZoomSpeed_Fastdescription|How fast should the mouse wheel zoom in or out your view when you are holding down the 'go faster' button?
Setting/setting/=MousewheelUIScrollSpeeddisplay_name|Mousewheel UI Scroll Speed
Setting/setting/=MousewheelUIScrollSpeeddescription|How fast should the scroll wheel move UI scrollbars when you spin it?  The default value is 30, which should be comfortable for most folks.  But if your OS has unusual settings, and the in-game interface feels like it scrolls to slowly, then go for a higher number.  If it's too fast, go for a lower number.
Setting/setting/=InvertMouseWheelUIScrollingdisplay_name|Invert Mousewheel UI Scrolling
Setting/setting/=InvertMouseWheelUIScrollingdescription|Normally when you spin the mouse wheel forward, any scrollable areas you are hovering over in the UI go up; spinning backwards goes down.  This lets you flip that functionality.  OR, in the case that your hardware or OS is inverted for whatever reason, this lets you correct it to work like everyone else.

Note: if you also want/need to invert how your mouse wheel works when zooming the game view, then be sure to also set the 'Invert Mouse Zoom' option in the Cameras tab.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Gamedisplay_name|Game
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Gamedescription|Basic settings for the game itself.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Expansionsdisplay_name|Expansions
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Expansionsdescription|Turn on and off official expansions for the game that you own.  Useful for playing multiplayer with friends who don't have the same content.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Modsdisplay_name|Mods
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Modsdescription|Turn on and off unofficial player mods for the game that you have installed.  Useful for playing multiplayer with friends, or just trying out different things.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Performancedescription|A wide variety of ways to improve performance or even let the game run on under-specced machines.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Displaydisplay_name|Display
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Displaydescription|Many different adjustments to how the game looks.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=UIScaledisplay_name|UI Scale
SettingCategory/setting_category/=UIScaledescription|Settings related to how large different parts of the UI are.  People have different preferences, different pixel densities, different screen sizes, etc.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Cameradisplay_name|Camera
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Cameradescription|Settings for how the (non-photo mode) cameras work and display things.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=PhotoModedescription|Settings for how photo mode works.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Inputdisplay_name|Input
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Inputdescription|The keybindings for the game are generally configured elsewhere.  So anything configurable here is likely adjusting how keys work.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Audiodisplay_name|Audio
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Audiodescription|Settings to control how the game sounds.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Networkingdisplay_name|Networking
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Networkingdescription|Settings relevant for when you are playing multiplayer.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Customdisplay_name|Custom
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Customdescription|Custom settings from mods and otherwise.
SettingCategory/setting_category/=Debugdescription|Lots of options for logging and otherwise debugging info about the game.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=UIElementsdisplay_name|UI Elements
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=UIElementsdescription|Some people prefer a less cluttered UI, others want more guides to things that are going on.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Experimentsdisplay_name|Experiments
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Experimentsdescription|These are experimental gameplay behaviors that we'd usually like feedback on.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FullscreenModedisplay_name|Fullscreen Mode
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FullscreenModedescription|These settings only apply when the game is running in fullscreen (not windowed!) mode.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=WindowedModedisplay_name|Windowed Mode
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=WindowedModedescription|These settings only apply when the game is running in windowed (not fullscreen!) mode.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FullscreenEffectsdisplay_name|Fullscreen Effects (Post-Processing)
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FullscreenEffectsdescription|Adjust things related to screen-wide post-processing effects in the game.  Whether these are related to personal preference, hardware compatibility, or otherwise.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=AntiAliasingdisplay_name|Anti-Aliasing
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=AntiAliasingdescription|Adjust things related to anti-aliasing, which is another fullscreen effect.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Tooltipsdisplay_name|Tooltips
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Tooltipsdescription|Adjustments to what is shown in tooltips
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=HUDdisplay_name|HUD
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=HUDdescription|Configuration relating to the heads up display (most of the interface) for the game.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Sidebardisplay_name|Sidebar
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Sidebardescription|Configuration relating to the sidebar in the game.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SelectedShipsdisplay_name|Selected Ships/Fleets Window
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SelectedShipsdescription|Configuration relating to the window that shows the selected ships display in the bottom-right corner of the screen.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MasterControlsdisplay_name|Master Controls
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MasterControlsdescription|The overall controls for audio.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SoundMixingdisplay_name|Sound Mixing
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SoundMixingdescription|Adjust the relative volume of a lot of different parts of the game.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MainCameradescription|Settings for the normal top-down camera view.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MainCameraSpeedsdisplay_name|Main Camera Control Speeds
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MainCameraSpeedsdescription|Settings for the speed of controls while using the normal city camera.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=BattleCameraSpeedsdisplay_name|Battle Camera Control Speeds
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=BattleCameraSpeedsdescription|Settings for the speed of controls while using the top-down battle mode camera.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MainCameraDOFdisplay_name|Main Camera Depth Of Field
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MainCameraDOFdescription|Settings for the depth of field for the camera when it is not in photo mode.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=PhotoModeCameradisplay_name|Photo Mode Camera
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=PhotoModeCameradescription|Settings for the camera in photo mode.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=PhotoModeDOFdisplay_name|Photo Mode Depth Of Field
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=PhotoModeDOFdescription|Settings for the depth of field of the camera in photo mode (in photo mode, depth of field cannot be disabled).
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Mousedisplay_name|Mouse Controls
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Mousedescription|Adjust how your mouse behaves.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=VisualLoaddisplay_name|Visual Load Reduction
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=VisualLoaddescription|These items generally reduce the amount of visual load (mix of CPU and GPU, but mostly GPU) that the game requires.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=CPULoaddisplay_name|CPU Load Reduction
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=CPULoaddescription|These items generally reduce the amount of CPU load that the game requires.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GraphicsGPULoaddisplay_name|GPU Load Reduction
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GraphicsGPULoaddescription|These items generally reduce the amount of GPU load that the game requires.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Loggingdisplay_name|Logging
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Loggingdescription|These items generally give you information about how things are performing, but slow them down a bit while doing so.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=NetPrivacydisplay_name|Privacy
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=NetPrivacydescription|If you are streaming multiplayer, you may wish to hide certain info for privacy.  There's a limit to just how much we can hide while still having it be functional, though.  So that's the amount we hide.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=YourIPsdisplay_name|Your IP Address Information
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=YourIPsdescription|Information about your IP Addresses for your convenience if you need it.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MapRelateddisplay_name|Map Related
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=MapRelateddescription|Settings related to the map or mapgen.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DebugTooltipsdisplay_name|Debug Tooltips
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DebugTooltipsdescription|Settings to showing extra debugging in tooltips.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GameLoggingdisplay_name|Game Logging
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GameLoggingdescription|Settings to write extra logs about what the game is doing.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DracosItemsdisplay_name|Draco's Items
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DracosItemsdescription|Settings to show things that help Draco debug some of his items.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DebugOtherdescription|Settings for debug items that don't fit anywhere else.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=EscapeMenuAdditionsdisplay_name|Escape Menu Additions
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=EscapeMenuAdditionsdescription|These add extra information to the escape menu.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DataIntegritydisplay_name|Data Integrity
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=DataIntegritydescription|These write logs to disk about various pieces of data so that we can verify intended changes over time, or verify correctness after changes.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Serializationdisplay_name|Serialization
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=Serializationdescription|These write logs to disk when data is serialized or deserialized for purposes of writing savegames.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GameFrameworkdisplay_name|Game Framework
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=GameFrameworkdescription|These let us debug various parts of the underlying game framework.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=NetworkLoggingdisplay_name|Network Logging
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=NetworkLoggingdescription|The ability to log all sorts of things about the network to your disk if there are problems happening.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SaveSafeModsdisplay_name|Save-Safe Mods
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=SaveSafeModsdescription|These mods don't require all the players in a multiplayer game to have them on.  Additionally, you can load a savegame that had such a mod without it showing as present.
      
A number of these change balance for the game, and in multiplayer it's a good idea for all players to have those same mods on, but it's not required.  In cases where ships stats or other mechanics differ, the host's simulation will take precedence.

In other cases, if these are purely cosmetic, then it really doesn't matter what things look like to you versus someone else.
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FrameworkModsdisplay_name|Framework Mods
SettingSubcategory/setting_subcategory/=FrameworkModsdescription|These mods don't do anything directly.  They provide functionality for other mods to use.  Other mods will turn them on if they are needed.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Anarchydisplay_name|Anarchy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Anarchydescription|No central government body, but the people have some representatives for trade with other planets.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Aristocracydisplay_name|Aristocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Aristocracydescription|Nobility systems for the space age.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Bureaucracydisplay_name|Bureaucracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Bureaucracydescription|Leadership is a job like any other.  Most decisions are made by state officials, rather than anyone elected, born into it, or otherwise.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Communismdisplay_name|Communism
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Communismdescription|A society without classes, where the public owns everything jointly.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=CorpoStatedisplay_name|Corpo-State
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=CorpoStatedescription|One or more corporations rule, via some degree of totalitarianism.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Councildisplay_name|Council
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Councildescription|A governing council is elected or drafted via various means, and rules for specific terms.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Cyberocracydisplay_name|Cyberocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Cyberocracydescription|Since true artificial intelligence seems to be impossible, complex sets of algorithms are used to set social policies, distribution of goods and jobs, and so on.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Demarchydisplay_name|Demarchy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Demarchydescription|Power is held by those who win a random lottery, but only for a certain amount of time.  As the saying goes, leaders may be released early for good behavior.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Democracydisplay_name|Democracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Democracydescription|The public are given votes to elect representatives in their government.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Dictatorshipdisplay_name|Dictatorship
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Dictatorshipdescription|Rule is exercised by the few who are in central power, often with brutal suppression of dissent.  Details vary.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Empiredisplay_name|Empire
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Empiredescription|A collection of multiple aligned states controlled by one central, often totalitarian or monarchist, authority.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Federationdisplay_name|Federation
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Federationdescription|Rather than one central government, a collection of aligned-but-independent governments work togther.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Feudaldisplay_name|Feudal
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Feudaldescription|Taking the idea of an aristocracy to the next level, with complex obligations between lords and vassals in a land-owner-focused government.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Gerontocracydisplay_name|Gerontocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Gerontocracydescription|Power is held by the elders of society.  Not uncommon to see cryosleep used to extend the rule of the eldest for generations.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Kritarchydisplay_name|Kritarchy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Kritarchydescription|Power is held by a judicial system, and customary law is set by judges without any form of statutory law to assist.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Meritocracydisplay_name|Meritocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Meritocracydescription|Citizens who score the best on various aptitude tests are assigned leadership positions.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Monarchydisplay_name|Monarchy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Monarchydescription|The population is ruled by an individual with absolute power that is passed down via bloodlines.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Oligarchydisplay_name|Oligarchy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Oligarchydescription|A small sect of wealthy elites rule, in public or in secret.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Plutocracydisplay_name|Plutocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Plutocracydescription|Wealth equals power, literally.  As the money of a citizen rises or falls, so does their personal representation and political capabilities.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Republicdescription|Power is held by the citizenry through a variety of forms of legislative bodies.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Stratocracydisplay_name|Stratocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Stratocracydescription|Power is held by a military hierarchy, with enlisted officers enforcing most decisions.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Technocracydisplay_name|Technocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Technocracydescription|Power is held by the skilled, and in particular the intellectual.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Theocracydisplay_name|Theocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Theocracydescription|A central religious ideological body rules over the people, often with requirements of strict adherence to religious doctrine.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Timocracydisplay_name|Timocracy
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Timocracydescription|Power is held by the honorable, who are typically often aggressive or outright warlike.
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Triumviratedisplay_name|Triumvirate
SpaceNationType/space_nation_type/=Triumviratedescription|Three co-equal rulers share absolute power, with the intent that they each act as a check against the other.
Tech/tech/=IntrusionDiscoverydisplay_name|Intrusion Discovery
Tech/tech/=IntrusionDiscoverydescription|Techniques for discovering new intrusion vectors into hardened systems.
Tech/tech/=FlexibleProcessingPowerdisplay_name|Flexible Processing Power
